snippet: Bill Lee, the 84-year-old father of Spike Lee and a veteran jazz and session bassist and pianist, has been making music in his home for 40 years. The complaints started when new people moved in next door.
abstract: Bill Lee, 84-year-old father of Spike Lee and veteran jazz and session bassist and pianist, has been making music in his Fort Greene, Brooklyn, home for 40 years; Lee's music, long tolerated, has become subject of number of complaints by neighbors, shift he and others attribute to gentrification.
lead_paragraph: Bill Lee, the 84-year-old father of Spike Lee and a veteran jazz and session bassist and pianist, has been making music in his home for 40 years. The complaints started when new people moved in next door.

headline.seo: In Brooklyn, Bill Lee’s Music Is His Neighbor’s Headache
headline.main: One Man’s Music Is His Neighbor’s Headache
headline.print_headline: One Man’s Music Is His Neighbor’s Headache
